entry.title: Adapting to the unpredictable Trump-Vance administration

media:group.media:title: Adapting to the unpredictable Trump-Vance administration
media:group.media:description:
In this Civilnet podcast episode, host Patrick Elliott sits down with political commentator Eric Hacopian to dissect the shifts in the global political landscape during the first month of the Trump presidency. They explore the rise of populism in Europe and the U.S., analyze the implications of Trump's conflicting promises and actions regarding the war in Ukraine, and evaluate how Armenia must adapt its strategic diversification efforts to navigate the unpredictable Trump-Vance administration.

entry.title: Baku accuses Ruben Vardanyan of planning assassination of Azerbaijani diplomats

media:group.media:title: Baku accuses Ruben Vardanyan of planning assassination of Azerbaijani diplomats
media:group.media:description:
üìç Former Armenian President Robert Kocharyan strongly advocated for the continued existence of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe‚Äôs Minsk Group during a press conference held today in Yerevan. üìç At the Munich Security Conference this past weekend, Pashinyan met with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, European Council President Antonio Costa, and the OSCE Secretary General Feridun Sinirlioƒülu to discuss regional security. üìç Azerbaijani authorities have accused philanthropist Ruben Vardanyan, who briefly served as state minister of Nagorno-Karabakh, of orchestrating a plot against Azerbaijani diplomats abroad.

entry.title: Search for investors in Armenia ‚Äòdry port‚Äô project stalls: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Search for investors in Armenia ‚Äòdry port‚Äô project stalls: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Armenian government has still not begun construction on its ‚Äòdry port‚Äô logistics project in the northwestern city of Gyumri, as talks with international investors stall. üìçStriking employees agreed to return to work at the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine in exchange for increased wages and better working conditions. The company, Armenia‚Äôs largest, reported daily losses of about $1 million during the 11-day strike. üìç Iran cannot replace Russia as Armenia‚Äôs gas supplier, says former official: https://shorturl.at/xCLFS üìç Armenia unlikely to build modular nuclear power plant, says former official: https://shorturl.at/pnNuQ
